summary: This document is an email chain from July 2021 between federal prosecutors and law enforcement agents discussing the need to obtain birth certificates for victims in the Epstein case via trial subpoenas. It reveals ongoing trial preparation efforts by the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York Field Office working on child exploitation/human trafficking, coordinating to obtain birth certificates for victims via subpoena.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York leading trial preparation, requesting birth certificates for victims including those named in the indictment.

connections.description: Prosecutor requests the FBI agent to take the lead on gathering victim birth certificates for trial, indicating a working law enforcement-legal collaboration.

events.title: Request for Victim Birth Certificates
events.description: Federal prosecutor emails law enforcement to request gathering birth certificates for victims listed in the indictment and another individual, for trial preparation.

events.title: Follow-up on Birth Certificate Request
events.description: Email follow-up checking on the progress of obtaining birth certificates, noting that trial subpoenas will likely be needed.

events.title: Subpoena Preparation for NY and CA
events.description: FBI agent specifies need for a trial subpoena to the New York State Department of Health and anticipates one for California, indicating active steps to secure records.

locations: New York State Department of Health Vital Records Certification Unit, Albany, NY 12220
Southern District of New York, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively preparing for trial in July 2021, seeking birth certificates for victims via trial subpoenas.
The request specifically targeted birth certificates for 'the four victims in the indictment' plus at least one additional individual.
The communication indicates coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and FBI/possibly NYPD on evidence gathering.
The email chain shows a planned approach to avoid using MLATs (Mutual Legal Assistance Treaties) for victims born abroad.
